page.title: 05The Priory, Southwick
page.content: The remains of the Priory buildings are to be seen to the south west of Southwick House. As the site of the Priory has never been excavated, we know nothing about the Priory Church and what remains above ground appears to be part of the Refectory. The Parish Church of Southwick {"St James-outside-the-Priory-Gate" contains windows and carved stones removed from the Priory Church after the Reformation. The destruction of the Priory was due to the break with the Catholic Church and the establishment of Henry VIII-who had visited the shrine of "Our Lady of Southwick" and made an offering in 1510 of 6s 8d- as Head of the English Church, the possesions of the Priory were granted to John White in 1539.
